qas.question: Who has the world's largest administrative judicial system?
What US Department oversees the World's largest administrative judicial system?
In what year did the SSA see a 55% increase in videoconferenced hearings?
When did the SSA open its largest videoconferencing-only center?
Where is the SSA's fifth videoconferencing only center located?
In 2010 how many hearings did the U.S. SSA conduct?

plausible_answers.text: opened its fifth and largest videoconferencing-only National Hearing Center (NHC), in St. Louis, Missouri

qas.question: What did the ODAR do to clear its hearing backlog in August 2010?

plausible_answers.text: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Baltimore, Maryland, Falls Church, Virginia, and Chicago, Illinois.

qas.question: In what locations has the ODAR opened NHC's since 2007?
By what percentage did the SSA's hearing backlog increase in 2009?

plausible_answers.text: the world's largest administrative judicial system

qas.question: What does the NHC oversee under its ODAR?

context: The <a0_0>U.S.<a0_0/> <a1_0>Social Security Administration (SSA)<a1_0/>, which oversees <b9_0>the world's largest administrative judicial system<b9_0/> under its Office of Disability Adjudication and Review (ODAR), has made extensive use of videoconferencing to conduct hearings at remote locations. In Fiscal Year (FY) <a2_0>2009<a2_0/>, the U.S. Social Security Administration (SSA) conducted <b5_0>86,320<b5_0/> videoconferenced hearings, a <b8_0>55%<b8_0/> increase over FY 2008. In <a3_0>August 2010<a3_0/>, the SSA <b6_0>opened its fifth and largest videoconferencing-only National Hearing Center (NHC), in <a4_0>St. Louis, Missouri<b6_0/><a4_0/>. This continues the SSA's effort to use video hearings as a means to clear its substantial hearing backlog. Since 2007, the SSA has also established NHCs in <b7_0>Albuquerque, New Mexico, Baltimore, Maryland, Falls Church, Virginia, and Chicago, Illinois.
